greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of distinct prime factors in the product of prime indices of n.
comment: A prime index of n is a number m such that prime(m) divides n. The multiset of prime indices of n is row n of A112798.
First appearance of n is A062447(n - 1).
example: 9193 has prime indices {10, 66} with product 660, which has 4 distinct prime factors {2, 3, 5, 11}, so a(9193) = 4.
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(v = factor(n)[, 1]); omega(prod(i = 1, #v, primepi(v[i]))) \\ _David A. Corneth_, Dec 29 2018
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Dec 28 2018
